summary: In this context, urea and carbonates are indirectly related through the digestive processes in fish, particularly in the context of urea production and excretion. The study highlights the role of the intestine in producing urea from ammonia, with the delayed appearance of urea corresponding to the presence of fecal matter and carbonate pellets. This suggests a potential link between urea metabolism and carbonate formation during digestion, although the specifics of their interaction are not deeply explored.
